blocks.content: Social engineering means tricking people into giving information or performing actions that help an attacker. In naval style, it is like an enemy disguising themselves as a friendly ship to get access to restricted waters. Instead of attacking systems, social engineering targets human trust.

content: Can steal passwords or sensitive data

blocks.content: SE-Toolkit is a powerful toolkit used for social engineering attacks. We can use it to clone real websites to trick victims into entering their credentials. This is for educational and lab purposes only.

content: Why: To start the Social Engineering Toolkit.
Why: To create fake login pages.
Why: To capture login usernames and passwords.
Why: To clone a real website for testing.

blocks.content: Email spoofing means sending an email that looks like it came from someone else. In naval terms, it is like faking a message from a navy commander to mislead ships. Emkei.cz is a free tool used for spoofing emails for educational purposes.

content: Why: Allows sending fake emails for testing.
Why: Makes the email look real to the target.
Set 'To' address: Victim test email (lab only)
Why: To demonstrate social engineering attacks safely.
Why: Shows how easy it is to spoof emails and why awareness is important.

blocks.content: >> MODULE 09 COMPLETE. NEXT MODULE WILL COVER WEB APPLICATION HACKING AND OWASP TOP 10.
